content:
You'll find plenty of great lunch spots near the Fairmont in San Francisco that serve healthy options. Here are some recommendations within walking distance:

1. Eatsa: A quick and healthy option with a location just a block away from the Fairmont. Eatsa serves quinoa-based bowls with various toppings, soups, and salads.
2. Mixt Greens: A popular salad chain with a location near the Fairmont. They offer a variety of creative salads, wraps, and soups made with fresh, sustainable ingredients.
3. Sweetgreen: Another healthy salad spot with a location nearby. Sweetgreen sources local and organic ingredients and offers vegan and gluten-free options.
4. The Plant Cafe: A organic, plant-based cafe about a 5-minute walk from the Fairmont. They serve salads, bowls, sandwiches, and soups, as well as fresh juices and smoothies.
5. Bluestone Lane: An Australian-inspired cafe with a location near the Fairmont. They offer healthy sandwiches, salads, and bowls, as well as avocado toast and other breakfast items.

All of these options are within a 10-minute walk from the Fairmont and offer healthy, nutritious options to fuel your workday.

If you're in the mood for something more substantial, you could also try:

1. The Grove: A California-inspired bistro with a location near the Fairmont. They offer seasonal salads, sandwiches, and entrees made with fresh, locally sourced ingredients.
2. Delarosa: A modern Italian restaurant with a location nearby. They offer healthy pasta dishes, salads, and paninis, as well as a daily happy hour menu.

Let me know if you have any other preferences or dietary restrictions, and I can give you more tailored recommendations!
